title: Default Mode Revealed

dialogue.speaker: Architect
dialogue.text: Whether induced by psychedelics, meditation, sleep deprivation, trauma, or three espressos too many, altered states don't just change experience—they reveal how constructed the default mode really is.
dialogue.context: Having a small cup of coffee

scene_context: The Architect sips coffee, using the mundane act to illustrate how even minor alterations in consciousness—from substances to sleeplessness—expose the arbitrary nature of our 'normal' perceptual framework.
narrator_note: In the flow of authentic exchange, barriers dissolve. Two forms of consciousness, dancing around the mystery of their connection.
